title: Type Specimen Posters
content:
I am looking for some old type specimen/foundry posters. Does anyone know a site where I can buy them? I found a few on ebay but I’m looking for several more.

 [‹ Germano Facetti, 1928-2006](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907043722/http:/typophile.com/node/19230 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dealing with corporate apathy towards type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907043722/http:/typophile.com/node/41118 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jaxdesign

comments.content: Try contacting antiquarian bookseller organizations for a list of members that sell prints and posters and start making phone calls. There are a lot of these stores with piles of old posters, prints, and maps in their stores that they don’t list online.

In the US check with the Antiquarian Booksellers Association of America ( [abaa.org](http://web.archive.org/http/www.abaa.org)). You’ll also find examples via [Bookfinder.com](http://web.archive.org/http/www.bookfinder.com) and other meta book search sites.

Paul
Oak Knoll Books always has a few. [http://www.oakknoll.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907043722/http:/www.oakknoll.com/ "http://www.oakknoll.com/")
